result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial - 12 person on April 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Information received. Waive further reading. Not guilty pleas entered. To be set for status and trial. Bond continued.

Arraignment scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Close to resolution.

22TR1582 & 22TR1373 reopened and riding along.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Bond mailed for signature.

BOND COVERS 22CF217 & 22CF292
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

11:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant SETH I RIEBE in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for SETH I RIEBE. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF292. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADA Matthews requests a cash bond due to the new felony bond violations. 
Attorney Harless requests cash bond in 22CF217 to apply to 22CF292. Defendant recently obtained employment. 
Court orders bond in 22CF217 to apply to 22CF292. Court warns defendant if there's any further bond violations a high cash bond will be placed on defendant.
Bail/bond hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

1:20 PM Defendant SETH I RIEBE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for SETH I RIEBE.  Attorney Sara Matthews in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Request for bond modification to either modify to signature bond or lower cash amount
State objects
Victim makes a statement
Court will release defendant on $500 cash bond with same conditions
Court will allow electronic communication with victim one for purposes of discussing the children
Appeared in bonds during Branch 1 intake.
